page.title: 11Jacksons Mill
page.content: The mill is 153 years old, it was built in 1832 by John Lamb. The mill was used for grinding corn from Jackson's Farm. From 1884 until 1919 Jackson's Mill was used as a scarlet fever and smallpox hospital. Mr Jackson was the first man to own the mill. Mr Archer bought it off Mr Jackson then Mr Hunter bought it in 1977. Mr Hunter has ren ovated it. He built an extension on the side. It took 14 months to repair. There are 3 bedrooms, 4 floors, and 7 rooms altogether. It is made from stone. It is heated by coal fired central heating. There is a lovely spiral staircase made from wood and wrought iron. On the ground floor there is a living room, dining room, bathroom and kitchen. There are two bedrooms on the first floor & one on the third floor. The top floor is used for storage.
